name: Hogs
source: U. S. Bureau of the Census. U. S. Census of Agriculture: 1950. Vol. II, General Report, Statistics by Subject. U. S. Government Printing Office, Washington, D. C., 1952; USDA, National Agricultural Statistics Service. 1987 Census of Agriculture; USDA, National Agricultural Statistics Service. 2012 Census of Agriculture; USDA, National Agricultural Statistics Service. 2017 Census of Agriculture
help:
JSON format help for XY plots
-----------------------------
Downloadable JSON files for Who Are We Now? are dictionaries.

They always have a "type" field specifying the plot type, and a "name"
field, specifying the plot name. https://whoarewenow.net/plotname
will redirect you to the location of any plot in its chapter.

This one's type is "XY", for plotting arbitrary 2D lines and polygons.

JSON entries with example values:

Key        Value                 Comment
-------    --------------------  -------------------------------------
"type"   : "XY"
"name"   : "PlotName"
"ax"     : "X axis name"
"ay"     : "Y axis name"
"log"    : [0,0]                 Booleans 0|1 for log X or Y axis
"seq"    : [Seq1,Seq2,...]       Each sequence is a map per below
"series" : [Series1,Series2,...] Each series is a map per below

Seq specifies the sequence of "stops" in the visualization:

Key        Value                 Comment
-------    --------------------  -------------------------------------
"i"      : [0,1,2]               Indices of series to render
"x"      : [1900,2022]           X range for this stop
"y"      : [0,3.5]               Y range for this stop

Series specifies the data for all series, as specified by each "i" in "seq":

Key        Value                 Comment
-------    -------------------   -------------------------------------
"s"      : "All respondents"     Series label
"c"      : "black"               Series color
"a"      : 0.5                   Series alpha (opacity)
"w"      : 1.                    Series line width (use 0 for polygon)
"x"      : [1900,1910,...]       Series X values
"y"      : [1.2,1.4,...]         Series Y values

Some dictionary key/value pairs are unimportant, used only for debugging or
offline viewing, and are not documented above.

For more information on the project see https://whoarewenow.net#about
